title: Importance of Jnana, Bala & Kriya in Service  | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | SB 3.22.3 | 17.07.2024
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.text: Reading from Srimad Parvatam, Canto 3, Chapter 22, Verse 3
Translation and purport by His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Shila Prabhupada
For the protection of the Brahmanas,
the thousand-leaded Supreme Being created us, the Satryas,
Hence the Brahmanas are said to be His heart and the Satryas, His arms.
Purport by His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Shila Prabhupada
Satryas are specifically meant to maintain the Brahmanas
because if the Brahmanas are protected
and the head of civilization is protected,
Brahmanas are supposed to be protected.
Brahmanas are supposed to be the head of the social body.
If the head is clear and has not gone mad,
then everything is in proper position.
The purport of this prayer is that
the Lord specifically protects the Brahmanas and the crows,
and then He protects all other members of society.
It is His will that universal welfare work depends on the protection of crows and Brahmanas.
Thus Brahmanical culture and crow protection are the basic principles for human civilization.
Satryas are especially meant to protect the Brahmanas,
as is the supreme will of the Lord.
As the Supreme Will of the Lord, Grow Brahmana Hitayacha.
As the Supreme Will of the Lord, Grow Brahmana Hitayacha.
Because within the body, the heart is a very important part, so the brahmanas are also
the important element in human society.
The satryas are more like the whole body.
Even though the whole body is bigger than the heart, the heart is more important.

And this way, the brahamanas and kshatriyas protect each other as well as themselves.
